comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Per AWM records: Charles Griffen Clark Kerr (Service No. 1030)...served in WW1 as an 'air mechanic' in the Australian Flying Corps...Occupation: Engineer; 31 years of age on enlistment in 1916; Single (old-speak for 'not married'); Address: 39 Dinsdale-street, Albert Park (Melbourne)... Charles William Victor Booth (Service No. 1017) ...also served in the Australian Flying Corps; Occupation: Engineer/mechanic; 24 years of age on enlistment in 1916; Single...here's his enlistment form mappingouranzacs.naa.gov.au/details-permalink.aspx?barcod... Looks like that's Charles Kerr in charge of the bike here [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/10322247073/] I suspect we also see Charles Kerr here [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/10322309574/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Interestingly the AWM have two images in which Charles appears, courtesy of his time with the AFC. They are low res so you can't see him very well - but worth a look! www.awm.gov.au/collection/P02658.004 www.awm.gov.au/collection/E02660/
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
